30   package org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcontroller.external.samples;
31   
32   import android.graphics.Bitmap;
33   import android.graphics.ImageFormat;
34   import android.os.Handler;
35   
36   import androidx.annotation.NonNull;
37   
38   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.Disabled;
39   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.LinearOpMode;
40   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.eventloop.opmode.TeleOp;
41   import com.qualcomm.robotcore.util.RobotLog;
42   
43   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.ClassFactory;
44   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.android.util.Size;
45   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.function.Consumer;
46   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.function.Continuation;
47   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.Camera;
48   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraCaptureRequest;
49   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraCaptureSequenceId;
50   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraCaptureSession;
51   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraCharacteristics;
52   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraException;
53   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraFrame;
54   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.CameraManager;
55   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.external.hardware.camera.WebcamName;
56   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.collections.EvictingBlockingQueue;
57   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.network.CallbackLooper;
58   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system.AppUtil;
59   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system.ContinuationSynchronizer;
60   import org.firstinspires.ftc.robotcore.internal.system.Deadline;
61   
62   import java.io.File;
63   import java.io.FileOutputStream;
64   import java.io.IOException;
65   import java.util.Locale;
66   import java.util.concurrent.ArrayBlockingQueue;
67   import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
68   
69   /**
70    * This OpMode illustrates how to open a webcam and retrieve images from it. It requires a configuration
71    * containing a webcam with the default name ("Webcam 1"). When the opmode runs, pressing the 'A' button
72    * will cause a frame from the camera to be written to a file on the device, which can then be retrieved
73    * by various means (e.g.: Device File Explorer in Android Studio; plugging the device into a PC and
74    * using Media Transfer; ADB; etc)
75    */
76   @TeleOp(name="Concept: Webcam", group ="Concept")
77   @Disabled
78   public class ConceptWebcam extends LinearOpMode {
79   
80       //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
81       // State
82       //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
83   
84       private static final String TAG = "Webcam Sample";
85   
86       /** How long we are to wait to be granted permission to use the camera before giving up. Here,
87        * we wait indefinitely */
88       private static final int secondsPermissionTimeout = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
89   
90       /** State regarding our interaction with the camera */
91       private CameraManager cameraManager;
92       private WebcamName cameraName;
93       private Camera camera;
94       private CameraCaptureSession cameraCaptureSession;
95   
96       /** The queue into which all frames from the camera are placed as they become available.
97        * Frames which are not processed by the OpMode are automatically discarded. */
98       private EvictingBlockingQueue<Bitmap> frameQueue;
99   
100      /** State regarding where and how to save frames when the 'A' button is pressed. */
101      private int captureCounter = 0;
102      private File captureDirectory = AppUtil.ROBOT_DATA_DIR;
103  
104      /** A utility object that indicates where the asynchronous callbacks from the camera
105       * infrastructure are to run. In this OpMode, that's all hidden from you (but see {@link #startCamera}
106       * if you're curious): no knowledge of multi-threading is needed here. */
107      private Handler callbackHandler;
108  
109      //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
110      // Main OpMode entry
111      //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
112  
113      @Override public void runOpMode() {
114  
115          callbackHandler = CallbackLooper.getDefault().getHandler();
116  
117          cameraManager = ClassFactory.getInstance().getCameraManager();
118          cameraName = hardwareMap.get(WebcamName.class, "Webcam 1");
119  
120          initializeFrameQueue(2);
121          AppUtil.getInstance().ensureDirectoryExists(captureDirectory);
122  
123          try {
124              openCamera();
125              if (camera == null) return;
126  
127              startCamera();
128              if (cameraCaptureSession == null) return;
129  
130              telemetry.addData(">", "Press Play to start");
131              telemetry.update();
132              waitForStart();
133              telemetry.clear();
134              telemetry.addData(">", "Started...Press 'A' to capture frame");
135  
136              boolean buttonPressSeen = false;
137              boolean captureWhenAvailable = false;
138              while (opModeIsActive()) {
139  
140                  boolean buttonIsPressed = gamepad1.a;
141                  if (buttonIsPressed && !buttonPressSeen) {
142                      captureWhenAvailable = true;
143                  }
144                  buttonPressSeen = buttonIsPressed;
145  
146                  if (captureWhenAvailable) {
147                      Bitmap bmp = frameQueue.poll();
148                      if (bmp != null) {
149                          captureWhenAvailable = false;
150                          onNewFrame(bmp);
151                      }
152                  }
153  
154                  telemetry.update();
155              }
156          } finally {
157              closeCamera();
158          }
159      }
160  
161      /** Do something with the frame */
162      private void onNewFrame(Bitmap frame) {
163          saveBitmap(frame);
164          frame.recycle(); // not strictly necessary, but helpful
165      }
166  
167      //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
168      // Camera operations
169      //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
170  
171      private void initializeFrameQueue(int capacity) {
172          /** The frame queue will automatically throw away bitmap frames if they are not processed
173           * quickly by the OpMode. This avoids a buildup of frames in memory */
174          frameQueue = new EvictingBlockingQueue<Bitmap>(new ArrayBlockingQueue<Bitmap>(capacity));
175          frameQueue.setEvictAction(new Consumer<Bitmap>() {
176              @Override public void accept(Bitmap frame) {
177                  // RobotLog.ii(TAG, "frame recycled w/o processing");
178                  frame.recycle(); // not strictly necessary, but helpful
179              }
180          });
181      }
182  
183      private void openCamera() {
184          if (camera != null) return; // be idempotent
185  
186          Deadline deadline = new Deadline(secondsPermissionTimeout, TimeUnit.SECONDS);
187          camera = cameraManager.requestPermissionAndOpenCamera(deadline, cameraName, null);
188          if (camera == null) {
189              error("camera not found or permission to use not granted: %s", cameraName);
190          }
191      }
192  
193      private void startCamera() {
194          if (cameraCaptureSession != null) return; // be idempotent
195  
196          /** YUY2 is supported by all Webcams, per the USB Webcam standard: See "USB Device Class Definition
197           * for Video Devices: Uncompressed Payload, Table 2-1". Further, often this is the *only*
198           * image format supported by a camera */
199          final int imageFormat = ImageFormat.YUY2;
200  
201          /** Verify that the image is supported, and fetch size and desired frame rate if so */
202          CameraCharacteristics cameraCharacteristics = cameraName.getCameraCharacteristics();
203          if (!contains(cameraCharacteristics.getAndroidFormats(), imageFormat)) {
204              error("image format not supported");
205              return;
206          }
207          final Size size = cameraCharacteristics.getDefaultSize(imageFormat);
208          final int fps = cameraCharacteristics.getMaxFramesPerSecond(imageFormat, size);
209  
210          /** Some of the logic below runs asynchronously on other threads. Use of the synchronizer
211           * here allows us to wait in this method until all that asynchrony completes before returning. */
212          final ContinuationSynchronizer<CameraCaptureSession> synchronizer = new ContinuationSynchronizer<>();
213          try {
214              /** Create a session in which requests to capture frames can be made */
215              camera.createCaptureSession(Continuation.create(callbackHandler, new CameraCaptureSession.StateCallbackDefault() {
216                  @Override public void onConfigured(@NonNull CameraCaptureSession session) {
217                      try {
218                          /** The session is ready to go. Start requesting frames */
219                          final CameraCaptureRequest captureRequest = camera.createCaptureRequest(imageFormat, size, fps);
220                          session.startCapture(captureRequest,
221                              new CameraCaptureSession.CaptureCallback() {
222                                  @Override public void onNewFrame(@NonNull CameraCaptureSession session, @NonNull CameraCaptureRequest request, @NonNull CameraFrame cameraFrame) {
223                                      /** A new frame is available. The frame data has <em>not</em> been copied for us, and we can only access it
224                                       * for the duration of the callback. So we copy here manually. */
225                                      Bitmap bmp = captureRequest.createEmptyBitmap();
226                                      cameraFrame.copyToBitmap(bmp);
227                                      frameQueue.offer(bmp);
228                                  }
229                              },
230                              Continuation.create(callbackHandler, new CameraCaptureSession.StatusCallback() {
231                                  @Override public void onCaptureSequenceCompleted(@NonNull CameraCaptureSession session, CameraCaptureSequenceId cameraCaptureSequenceId, long lastFrameNumber) {
232                                      RobotLog.ii(TAG, "capture sequence %s reports completed: lastFrame=%d", cameraCaptureSequenceId, lastFrameNumber);
233                                  }
234                              })
235                          );
236                          synchronizer.finish(session);
237                      } catch (CameraException|RuntimeException e) {
238                          RobotLog.ee(TAG, e, "exception starting capture");
239                          error("exception starting capture");
240                          session.close();
241                          synchronizer.finish(null);
242                      }
243                  }
244              }));
245          } catch (CameraException|RuntimeException e) {
246              RobotLog.ee(TAG, e, "exception starting camera");
247              error("exception starting camera");
248              synchronizer.finish(null);
249          }
250  
251          /** Wait for all the asynchrony to complete */
252          try {
253              synchronizer.await();
254          } catch (InterruptedException e) {
255              Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
256          }
257  
258          /** Retrieve the created session. This will be null on error. */
259          cameraCaptureSession = synchronizer.getValue();
260      }
261  
262      private void stopCamera() {
263          if (cameraCaptureSession != null) {
264              cameraCaptureSession.stopCapture();
265              cameraCaptureSession.close();
266              cameraCaptureSession = null;
267          }
268      }
269  
270      private void closeCamera() {
271          stopCamera();
272          if (camera != null) {
273              camera.close();
274              camera = null;
275          }
276      }
277  
278      //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
279      // Utilities
280      //----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
281  
282      private void error(String msg) {
283          telemetry.log().add(msg);
284          telemetry.update();
285      }
286      private void error(String format, Object...args) {
287          telemetry.log().add(format, args);
288          telemetry.update();
289      }
290  
291      private boolean contains(int[] array, int value) {
292          for (int i : array) {
293              if (i == value) return true;
294          }
295          return false;
296      }
297  
298      private void saveBitmap(Bitmap bitmap) {
299          File file = new File(captureDirectory, String.format(Locale.getDefault(), "webcam-frame-%d.jpg", captureCounter++));
300          try {
301              try (FileOutputStream outputStream = new FileOutputStream(file)) {
302                  bitmap.compress(Bitmap.CompressFormat.JPEG, 100, outputStream);
303                  telemetry.log().add("captured %s", file.getName());
304              }
305          } catch (IOException e) {
306              RobotLog.ee(TAG, e, "exception in saveBitmap()");
307              error("exception saving %s", file.getName());
308          }
309      }
310  }
